content: So what are some good places to read up on Lean 3/4 specifically as a programing language, as opposed to using it for mathematics? I hang out on the mathlib discord server so I know lots about it as a prover.
The only resources specific to Lean (3) I know of are in the "tactic writing and metaprogramming" section of our Learning resources page.

Lean 4 is designed to be a useable programming language. Lean 3â€™s programming language is harder to use IMHO and mostly used for metaprogramming (writing tactics and other code to inspect internal lean objects).
If you are not familiar with the basics of monads, you can find good introductions on the internet by Googling. Also this is a good intro for monads in Lean although it might be really outdated.
